text: Sure you should do a repository on Github, but for the specific version (=a specific commit) that refers to the code exactlz used in the paper you want to have a fixed and doi-referenced place. That’s what Zenodo offers

elements.text: Sure you should do a repository on Github, but for the specific version (=a specific commit) that refers to the code exactlz used in the paper you want to have a fixed and doi-referenced place. That’s what Zenodo offers

text: So especially every Version of a Julia package can autmatically be equipped with a DOI
